Southwest Detroit Community School Profile (2020) | Detroit, MI
Southwest Detroit Community School in Detroit, Michigan serves 428 students in grades Kindergarten-12. View their 2020 profile to find rankings, test scores, reviews and more.

div.div: x
Navigation
Home > Michigan > Wayne County
Southwest Detroit Community School serves 428 students in grades Kindergarten-12.

The percentage of students achieving proficiency in Math is 8% (which is lower than the Michigan state average of 39%) for the 2016-17 school year. The percentage of students achieving proficiency in Reading/Language Arts is 12% (which is lower than the Michigan state average of 49%) for the 2016-17 school year.

Southwest Detroit Community School placed in the bottom 50% of all schools in Michigan for overall test scores (math proficiency is bottom 50%, and reading proficiency is bottom 50%) for the 2016-17 school year.
The student:teacher ratio of 19:1 is higher than the Michigan state level of 18:1.
Minority enrollment is 95% of the student body (majority Hispanic), which is higher than the Michigan state average of 34%.

div.p: Southwest Detroit Community School places among the top 20% of public schools in Michigan for:

span.a: Largest percent of students eligible for free lunch (Top 10%)

div.div: Southwest Detroit Community School's student population of 428 students has grown by 21% over five school years.
The teacher population of 23 teachers has grown by 15% over five school years.

img.title: This chart display the students of Southwest Detroit Community School by grade.

div.div: Southwest Detroit Community School is ranked within the bottom 50% of all 3,167 schools in Michigan (based off of combined Math and Reading proficiency testing data) for the 2016-17 school year.
The school's student:teacher ratio of 19:1 has increased from 18:1 over five school years.

The diversity score of Southwest Detroit Community School is 0.46, which is less than the diversity score at state average of 0.52. The school's diversity has stayed relatively flat over five school years.
